name: Mental Health Disaster Assistance and Emergency Mental Health
objective: To provide supplemental emergency mental health counseling to individuals affected by major disasters, including the training of workers to provide such counseling.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
sub_agency_name: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals
Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description: It is estimated 7 awards will be made. 10 awards were made.
It is estimated 20 awards will be made.
It is estimated 21 awards will be made.
It is estimated 100 awards will be made.

authorizations.text: 416, Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act.. Pub. L. 100, 707.
319(a), Public Health Service Act,  Public Law 78–410.

rules_regulations: See 44 CFR 205. Guidelines available in application kit. Disaster Assistance and Emergency Mental Health, HHS Publication No. (ADM) 76-327. HHS Grants Policy Statement, HHS  (Rev.) January 1, 2007.
